comment_body.0:
Location: Eastern US

Price Range: <$18k

Buy Used

Sedan

Must have: AWD, decent trunk space, leather, sunroof, smooth ride and good handling, must be reliable

Auto transmission

Intended use: Daily Driver, road trip car, fun weekend car.

Considered vehicles: 2012 Lexus IS350, 2010s Dodge Charger RT, 2006 Mercedes E55, Audi Quattro sedan,

This is my 2nd vehicle, No warranty, I can do maintenance and minor work on vehicle.

I’m 20m, so I’m looking for a fast, fun car I can take anywhere in the US. I want something that has room for passengers and a decent trunk for a sedan. I need something that won’t leave me stranded and won’t cost a ton to fuel up.
comment_body.1:
• Location: Ontario, Canada

• Price range: 0-25000 CAD

• Lease or Buy: Either

• New or used: Either, but at this price range probably used

• Type of vehicle: Sports sedan/hatch

• Must haves: Somewhat Fuel efficient, decent trunk space for a couple sets of golf clubs, useable second row seats(doesn't need ample space, just enough), android auto, decent reliability, smaller than a large sedan, heated seats

• Desired transmission (auto/manual, etc): Either is fine. Would prefer auto, but manual works too

• Intended use: Daily driver/fun car

• Vehicles you've already considered: Veloster n, golf gti, wrx, civic Si (Havnt searched much yet)

• Is this your 1st vehicle: No

• Do you need a Warranty: No

• Can you do Minor work on your own vehicle: Only very minor work like fuses, tires, batteries etc

• Can you do Major work on your own vehicle: No

• Additional Notes: Looking for something practical but fun. Willing to sacrifice some practicality for a little power/entertainment

comment_body.5:
Location: Midwest(Great lakes)

Price range: (20-40k)

Lease or Buy: Buy

New or used: Either

Type of vehicle: Sedan/SUV

Must haves: (Fun Factor, comfortable)

Desired transmission (auto/manual, etc): ( Manual but if Auto/ Non CVT)

Intended use: (Daily Driver)

Vehicles you've already considered: 9th gen Accord, CX-5, Type R,

Is this your 1st vehicle: No S200 is my summer/ weekend car

Do you need a Warranty: N/a

Additional Notes: Recently Sold my Manual ILX, reason for selling was pandemic/ and not needing a daily, and because after an accident I didn't want to hold on to a "beat" car. Some cons were that the ride quality was getting on my nerves, and my model had a very janky first gear clutch feel along with a very short first gear. But it did satisfy the "fun daily" engagement back when i did commute. Now I'm pondering on what next, I really enjoyed a test drive on a 9th gen accord manual, however the prices on these are a bit inflated RN, and i am not sure if I would be able to downgrade to cloth seats/non heated, no sunroof, average audio. However the engagement is up my alley and the comfort was significantly better than my ILX and a 2020 civic SI i also test drove. Reason i am not considering 2020 is the manual was pretty bad, long travel clutch and throws, design was meh, Felt far too large. thought about TYPE R, but after a shitty test drive ( bad dealer/ salesperson) the car seemed too much for my needs, cant go WOT in 1st or 2nd with out having mad wheel spin, you need to be going extremely fast in order to start having fun.

Then I thought a samll SUV(CX-5), perhaps i can just get a comfortable SUV that still has the luxury of not having, touch controls, cvt, start/stop, but has a good audio/ infotainment and nice modern luxuries.
comment_body.6:
San Diego, California

My max is 6000$

I wanna buy

Used is probaly all I could afford imma student.

I'm not looking for anything specific it just needs to be reliable and it needs to be able to handle everyday drive on a dirt road and as far as I know that usually only means SUVs and Trucks . Unfortunately I live in the rare part of San Diego county with a dirt road and because of this cars with low platform and suspensions only equipped for pavement break down very easily. I'd love to buy a civic or a Corolla but I'm simply not able to.

Needs to be automatic transmission

This is gonna be my daily drive I work from home and go to school at home so it won't be as much as before but I still live far from all my friends and family and anybody that lives in southern california knows that you definitely have to commute a fair amount.

I considered a 2001 CRV fell in love with the car before I even thought about buying a new car but I now realize the suspension on it is similar to that of a civic and I'm worried about how it will take the dirt road since it's pretty bumpy.

It's not my first vehicle I used to drive a ford ranger but the water pump broke and the radiator is having issues so it'll take far too much to fix.

I can't really do minor work on the vehicle I'm not that handy with cars but I'd be willing to pay to have minor work done if it all came within my price point.

I don't need a warranty.

comment_body.8:
• Location: US (Los Angeles)

  • Price Range: ~>25k (trying to keep payments no more than $350-$400; I have the down payment necessary) but not afraid to bump to 30k if necessary. I have a strong relationship with a credit union and won't be financing through the dealer ((unless it makes sense in negotiations)).

  • Lease or Buy: Preferably buy

  • New or Used: Used

  • Type of Vehicle: "Adult" version of my 2008 Scion XB

  • Must haves: 6 Cylinder if possible ((merging onto the freeway at speed)), no CVT. Never owned a 'modern' amenity car; always treated cars as tools and would like to treat myself.

  • Desired Transmission: Automatic

  • Intended use: Daily Driver + occasional weekend roadtrips

  • Vehicles already considered: 2018 Acura RDX w/

  • 1st Vehicle: NO

  • Warranty: never owned a car with one, so maybe?

  • Major/Minor work: No, but I'm youtube friendly and have learned how to replace side-view mirrors/headlights/taillights ETC.

  • Additional Notes: I am 6'2 and love head/leg space; no kids, just like roomy cars. I'm typically not a passenger in my own car. I love my '08 Scion but its getting pretty torn up and would like to purchase something a bit more 'adult'. I love my Scion for the utility of folding down the seats to increase storage/movement capacity ((I've been able to support many a move with this feature)). Occasionally have 4 people in my car. I like the size of the Scion and don't feel unsafe on the road as compared to, say, my '00 Honda Accord I used to own. Prefer Crossover/SUV instead of Sedan. Typically buy my cars to keep until the wheels fall off, as spending money on cars makes me uncomfortable. Thank you!

comment_body.32:
Hi guys!

We'll be joining a Rally (Not the offroad kind of Rally, but an organised roadtip) this summer (If covid permits), and we're looking for a good car, to drive 4000km. We are particully looking for a fun, but also comfortable car!

​

Location: Belgium (But car can be located in Germany or The Netherlands)

Price range: Max €6000 (List price may be higher, we're talking final price here. If the car is really awesome, and we can sell it afterwards for the same price, we can increase the budget).

Lease or Buy: Buy

New or used: Used - Oldtimer

Type of vehicle: No prefrence. Something either fun or special.

Must haves: Fun or Special! Basic comfort, since we'll be riding 4000km (in one week).

Desired transmission (auto/manual, etc): Manual

Intended use: Holiday Roadtrip (Going to Budapest from Belgium)

Vehicles you've already considered: Mainly Oldtimer BMW

Is this your 1st vehicle: Nope, we both have some more modern cars.

Do you need a Warranty: No!

Can you do Minor work on your own vehicle: Yes!

Can you do Major work on your own vehicle: (engine and transmission, timing belt/chains, body work, suspension etc )

Additional Notes: Mainly looking for Ideas! We thought about BMW which is quite Comfy and still fun to drive, but we're looking for other possibilities! We also looked into a Mazda MX-5, but we think it's to small. We need room for 2 people, and some luggage (camping) space.

​

Thanks!

comment_body.45:
I currently drive a Tesla Model S. Love it. Had it for 6 years. Happily use autopilot all the time, it has made me a much calmer driver. I’m not willing to give it up.

Are there any other all-electric cars out there that have a comparable autopilot system? I know they all have different names and none of them are truly auto pilot, but I want the functionality I have now and I’ll be happy. I don’t need the auto-lane changing, but I want the braking and lane holding.

All electric is a must. No model X. No model 3 or Y. I don’t know what Tesla has coming beyond that.

So are there any other options for me or do I just have to wait for a future Tesla model?

  • Is this your 1st vehicle: No

  • Can you do Minor work on your own vehicle: Yes

  • Can you do Major work on your own vehicle: No

  • Additional Notes: Ok, so heres my situation. I sold my 2016 accord when the pandemic started and I went full time WFH. Now that the end is in sight I'm going to need a new car. I had decided to get a new tesla model 3 for that self driving as my commute ranges from 20 minutes to an hour and 20 minutes in stop and go traffic. I cant stand going all the way down to zero on the highway, so I wanted a car that would do that part for me. Anyway, I decided to leave my safe corporate job for a startup that I'm cofounding, and my commute is going to go down to maybe 10 minutes with rush hour no longer being an issue. I'll also probably work from home a lot. My income should still be secure, we have funding to include my current salary for 4 years, and the potential upside is massive, but I still don't want to take on a massive payment right now.

So... I love driving stick and I figured I could probably take something a little less reliable with worse gas mileage for my shorter largely optional commute. I had a 2015 GTI that I loved, and an 08 WRX that I also loved. I'm wide open to all sorts of things here though. I've always wanted a manual 3 series, but I don't know too much about them.
